item.description:
Check your meetup.com email address for instructions! :)

See everyone Sunday at 9 a.m. at the Sullivan Square T-Station Parking Lot! Feel free to call Emilie (773-746-3710) or Jody (615-974-3103) if you have any questions. We will wait up to 15 minutes for those who are carpooling, so please be prompt!

 

Dear fellow B.A.ers, summer months can be scarce for meetups because a lot of people want to be out enjoying the weather. With that in mind, we decided to host a series of meetups that capitalize on this fact. This will be the first of hopefully several (and progressively more strenuous) hikes for those who are interested in or already passionate about hiking and want to do so with fellow Godless Bostonians this summer in a casual setting.

Our first destination: Mount Monadnock. It is one of the most frequented high peaks in New Hampshire and part of the White Mountain range, noted for its varied hiking trails and great views (e.g., http://bit.ly/IesTwk). And for the benefit of beginners and novice hikers, the summit is just under 4,000 feet. For more details on the White Dot Trail, please visit http://bit.ly/riC5mk.


This is a one day trip with the sole purpose of hiking to the summit of Mt. Monadnock. At a minimum, we require that anyone signing up have a basic fitness level comparable to walking 3 miles daily or running 3 miles three times per week. The hike will be 4 miles round trip and take an estimated 3-4 hours in total. This trail is often busy with hikers and rated a 3 out of 5 in difficulty, meaning it can be noticeably steep at times, you’ll be breathing in deeper and faster, and you’ll probably need to step up onto or over rocks, tree roots, etc. You'll definitely be burning calories!

We will be hiking at a moderate to brisk pace, but if there are enough participants, we can split off into two groups of slower and faster hikers that then reunite at the summit. We will want to keep all members together otherwise to keep on schedule.

 


Departure Details and Contact Info:


We will depart Saturday morning at 9 a.m. from the Sullivan Square T-Station. If you have a car, let us know the total occupancy in your RSVP details so we can arrange carpooling. Currently, we have 4 cars available. From the Sullivan Square T-Station, we will drive two hours up to the Mt Monadnock White Dot trailhead at Poole Road in Jaffrey, NH. It appears there may be a nominal parking fee as well, so please bring extra cash apart from gas money. More details to follow as the date approaches.


If you can't make the rendezvous at Sullivan Square, or if you happen to be running more than 10 minutes late, please call Emilie at 773-746-3710 (no texts, she doesn't have it) or call/text Jody at 615-974-3103 so we can make sure to be at the foot of the trail at the same time. GPS devices for driving directions to the trailhead are strongly recommended. A conservative estimated return time will be 4-5 PM, given standard car travel and hiking time estimates sans any problems.

***Note: For safety, anyone in sandals and/or lacking water will not be allowed to carpool with the group to Mt. Monadnock.


 

What You Need To Bring:


All summits are potentially hazardous due to high winds and unpredictable weather. Please bring appropriate provisions and hiking gear in preparation. Note it tends to be colder than expected at the summit. Please be sure to bring the following:

· Sturdy hiking boots (required)
· 2 liters of water minimum (required)
· Bag lunch and high-energy snacks like granola, nuts, energy bars, etc. (required)
· Wind and rain gear (required)
· Waterproof/breathable fabrics strongly recommended
· Synthetic or wool base layer – t-shirt, or underwear tops/btms
· Wool sweater or synthetic pile jacket
· A hat
· Gloves or mittens
· Extra socks (a welcome treat for the feet at mid-hike, or if you inadvertently step in a stream. They also double as mittens…)
· Bandanna or handkerchief
· Mini-First Aid Supplies



NOTE: HIKING HAS INHERENT RISKS. DO NOT ATTEND THIS MEETUP IF YOU ARE UNSURE IF YOU ARE ADEQUATELY PREPARED. AS A GROUP WE CAN DECREASE RISK BY BUDDYING UP AND LOOKING OUT FOR EACH OTHER BUT NOBODY IS LIABLE FOR YOU. THIS IS A VOLUNTARY HIKE. IF YOU ATTEND, YOU ARE ASSUMING THE RISK.
item.how_to_find_us: Sullivan Square T-station- email organizer for contact info
item.name: Day Hike - Mount Monadnock
